Class DiaryFacade

  • java.lang.Object
    • DiaryFacade
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class DiaryFacade
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DiaryFacade()
      tries to read a saved file from an earlier execution - if this fails, it creates a new one

      • createCalendarEntry

        public CalendarEntry createCalendarEntry(int yearStart,
                                         int monthStart,
                                         int dayStart,
                                         int hourStart,
                                         int minuteStart,
                                         int yearEnd,
                                         int monthEnd,
                                         int dayEnd,
                                         int hourEnd,
                                         int minuteEnd,
                                         java.lang.String description,
                                         java.lang.String summary,
                                         Location location,
                                         java.util.ArrayList<Ressource> ressources)
                                  throws StartEndException
        creates and returns a new CalendarEntry with the associated parameters (including all optional ones). It is automatically added to the facade classes ArrayList, and Ressources are automatically associated and cross-referenced
        Parameters:
        yearStart - year of the start instant in time
        monthStart - month of the start instant in time
        dayStart - day of the start instant in time
        hourStart - hour of the start instant in time
        minuteStart - minute of the start instant in time
        yearEnd - year of the end instant in time
        monthEnd - month of the end instant in time
        dayEnd - day of the end instant in time
        hourEnd - hour of the end instant in time
        minuteEnd - minute of the end instant in time
        description - description/title of the calendar entry
        summary - summary of the calendar entry
        location - location associated with the event of the calendar entry
        ressources - ressources associated with the event of the calendar entry
        Returns:
        CalendarEntry object with the specified parameters
        Throws:
        StartEndException - if the event end is ealier than the event start

      • createCalendarEntry

        public CalendarEntry createCalendarEntry(int yearStart,
                                         int monthStart,
                                         int dayStart,
                                         int hourStart,
                                         int minuteStart,
                                         int yearEnd,
                                         int monthEnd,
                                         int dayEnd,
                                         int hourEnd,
                                         int minuteEnd)
                                  throws StartEndException
        creates and returns a new CalendarEntry with only the required parameters. It is automatically added to the facade classes ArrayList, and Ressources are automatically associated and cross-referenced
        Parameters:
        yearStart - year of the start instant in time
        monthStart - month of the start instant in time
        dayStart - day of the start instant in time
        hourStart - hour of the start instant in time
        minuteStart - minute of the start instant in time
        yearEnd - end of the start instant in time
        monthEnd - month of the start instant in time
        dayEnd - day of the start instant in time
        hourEnd - hour of the start instant in time
        minuteEnd - minute of the start instant in time
        Returns:
        CalendarEntry object with the specified parameters
        Throws:
        StartEndException - if the event end is ealier than the event start

                                         Location location,
                                         java.util.ArrayList<Ressource> ressources)

        start - start instant of time
        end - end instant of time
        description - description/title of the calendar entry
        summary - summary of the calendar entry
        location - location associated with the event of the calendar entry
        ressources - ressources associated with the event of the calendar entry
        Returns:
        CalendarEntry object with the specified parameters
        Throws:
        StartEndException - if the event end is ealier than the event start

      • createWholeDayEvent

        public CalendarEntry createWholeDayEvent(int year,
                                         int month,
                                         int day,
                                         java.lang.String description,
                                         java.lang.String summary,
                                         Location location,
                                         java.util.ArrayList<Ressource> ressources)
                                  throws StartEndException
        creates and returns a Whole-Day event. It is automatically added to the facade classes ArrayList, and Ressources are automatically associated and cross-referenced

        month - month of the whole-day event
        day - day of the whole-day event
        description - description/title of the calendar entry
        summary - summary of the calendar entry
        location - location associated with the event

                                         Location location,
                                         java.util.ArrayList<Ressource> ressources)

      • createDailyEvent

        public java.util.ArrayList<CalendarEntry> createDailyEvent(int iterations,
                                                           java.time.LocalDateTime start,
                                                           java.time.LocalDateTime end,
                                                           java.lang.String description,
                                                           java.lang.String summary,
                                                           Location location,
                                                           java.util.ArrayList<Ressource> ressources)
                                                    throws StartEndException
        creates and returns a specified number of events recurring on a daily basis. They are automatically added to the facade classes ArrayList, and Ressources are automatically associated and cross-referenced
        Parameters:
        iterations - specifies how many repetitive events should be created
        start - start instant of time for the first event
        end - end instant of time for the first event
        description - description/title of the calendar entries
        summary - summary of the calendar entries
        location - location associated with the events
        ressources - ressources associated with the events
        Returns:
        ArrayList of CalendarEntry objects with the specified parameters
        Throws:
        StartEndException - if the event end is ealier than the event start

      • createTextOnlyLocation

        public Location createTextOnlyLocation(java.lang.String description)
        creates a Location object and sets the description. This object can be used in creation of a CalendarEntry.
        Parameters:
        description - a name or description for the location
        Returns:
        a Location object with the specified description and default latitude/longitude (0/0)

      • deleteEvent

        public void deleteEvent(CalendarEntry ce)
        removes an CalendarEntry from the central ArrayList. Associated Ressources are updated by removing the references.
        Parameters:
        ce - the CalendarEntry object to remove

      • deleteAllEvents

        public void deleteAllEvents()
        clears all data stored in the facade class

      • createOrAccessRessource

        public Ressource createOrAccessRessource(java.lang.String name)
        creates a new Ressource object. If a Ressource with the provided description already exists, it returns that one instead.
        Parameters:
        name - a name for the ressource
        Returns:
        a Ressource object with the specified name

      • addRessourcesToEvent

        public CalendarEntry addRessourcesToEvent(CalendarEntry ce,
                                          java.util.ArrayList<Ressource> res)
        Adds the specified Ressources to a CalendarEntry and updates the references accordingly
        Parameters:
        ce - the CalendarEntry that shall be allocated the ressource(s)
        res - the ressources that shall be allocated to the CalendarEntry
        Returns:
        the updated CalendarEntry object

      • removeRessourcesFromEvent

        public CalendarEntry removeRessourcesFromEvent(CalendarEntry ce,
                                               java.util.ArrayList<Ressource> res)
        removes the specified Ressources from a CalendarEntry and updates the references accordingly
        Parameters:
        ce - the CalendarEntry that shall get ressource(s) removed
        res - the ressources that shall be removed from the CalendarEntry
        Returns:
        the updated CalendarEntry object

      • getEventByUID

        public CalendarEntry getEventByUID(java.lang.String uid)
        returns an existing event with a known UID. If it does not exist, it returns null.
        Parameters:
        uid - UID to search for
        Returns:
        the event with the specified UID. If it does not exist, it returns null.

      • getEventsByDescription

        public java.util.ArrayList<CalendarEntry> getEventsByDescription(java.lang.String description)
        returns an ArrayList of existing events with a known description. If none exist, it returns null.
        Parameters:
        description - description to search for
        Returns:
        an ArryList of events with a matching description. If none exist, it returns null.

      • getEventsByLocation

        public java.util.ArrayList<CalendarEntry> getEventsByLocation(Location location)
        returns an ArrayList of existing events with a known Location object. it does NOT compare location descriptions only, as different locations might have the same description (e.g. "University), but different geographical coordinates. If no matching events exist, it returns null.
        Parameters:
        location - Location to search for
        Returns:
        ArrayList of matching CalendarEntry objects

      • getEventsByStartTime

        public java.util.ArrayList<CalendarEntry> getEventsByStartTime(java.time.LocalDateTime start)
        returns an ArrayList of existing events with a known start time. If none exist, it returns null.
        Parameters:
        start - search parameter start instant of time
        Returns:
        ArrayList of matching CalendarEntry objects

      • getEventsByEndTime

        public java.util.ArrayList<CalendarEntry> getEventsByEndTime(java.time.LocalDateTime end)
        returns an ArrayList of existing events with a known end time. If none exist, it returns null.
        Parameters:
        end - search parameter end instant of time
        Returns:
        ArrayList of matching CalendarEntry objects

      • getEventsCompletelyWithinTimespan

        public java.util.ArrayList<CalendarEntry> getEventsCompletelyWithinTimespan(java.time.LocalDateTime from,
                                                                            java.time.LocalDateTime to)
        returns an ArrayList of CalendarEntries that start and end between a specified timespan defined by "from" and "to". If none exist, it returns null.
        Parameters:
        from - search parameter start instant of time
        to - end search parameter end instant of time
        Returns:
        ArrayList of CalendarEntry objects scheduled to start and end within the timespan

      • getEventsPartiallyWithinTimespan

        public java.util.ArrayList<CalendarEntry> getEventsPartiallyWithinTimespan(java.time.LocalDateTime from,
                                                                           java.time.LocalDateTime to)
        returns an ArrayList of CalendarEntries that intersect at least partially with a specified timespan which is defined by "from" and "to". If none exist, it returns null.
        Parameters:
        from - search parameter start instant of time
        to - end search parameter end instant of time
        Returns:
        ArrayList of CalendarEntry objects intersecting the specified timespan

      • checkRessourceForConflictingEvents

        public java.util.ArrayList<CalendarEntry> checkRessourceForConflictingEvents(Ressource r)
        checks a given Ressource for allocated events that intersect. Returns an ArrayList of all confliting CalendarEntries associated with the Ressource. If no conflicting events exist, it returns an empty ArrayList.
        Parameters:
        r - Ressource to check for conflicting allocated events
        Returns:
        ArrayList of CalendarEntry objects associated to the ressource that overlap

      • ressourceIsAvailiableBetween

        public boolean ressourceIsAvailiableBetween(Ressource r,
                                            java.time.LocalDateTime start,
                                            java.time.LocalDateTime end)
        Returns a boolean indicating whether the Ressource is not yet used between a specified timespan, defined by "start" and "end".
        Parameters:
        r - Ressource to test
        start - start instant of timespan to test
        end - end instant of timespan to test
        Returns:
        true if no CalendarEntries are scheduled to use the ressource for the specified timespan, else false

      • getEventsAllocatedToRessource

        public java.util.ArrayList<CalendarEntry> getEventsAllocatedToRessource(Ressource r)
        Returns an ArrayList of CalendarEntries that are allocated to the given Ressource. If none exist, it returns an empty ArrayList.
        Parameters:
        r - Ressource to use
        Returns:
        ArrayList of CalendarEntries allocated to the Ressource

      • getFreeTimeBetween

        public java.time.Duration getFreeTimeBetween(CalendarEntry firstEvent,
                                             CalendarEntry secondEvent)
        Returns the time between the end of firstEvent and the start of secondEvent as a Duration object. Does not check whether the events are overlapping or provided in the wrong order.
        Parameters:
        firstEvent - earlier event
        secondEvent - later event
        Returns:
        Duration between the end of the first event and the start of the second event

      • printAllCalendarEntries

        public void printAllCalendarEntries()
        prints all CalendarEntries to the console

      • exportToICAL

        public void exportToICAL(java.util.ArrayList<CalendarEntry> events,
                         java.lang.String filename)
        Exports the given ArrayList of CalendarEntries to an iCal format file (.ics).
        Parameters:
        events - ArrayList of CalendarEntry objects to export
        filename - user-defined filename (does not require the file extension)

      • importEventsFromIcalFile

        public void importEventsFromIcalFile(java.lang.String filename)
        Imports an iCal format file and creates a CalendarEntry for each included event. Existing events with the same UID get updated, the old event will be overwritten - when this happens, an information will be printed to the console.
        Parameters:
        filename - file to import. Must be in the same directory.
